noun.description: A mineral consisting of a fluoride of cerium and lanthanum (in varying proportions), typically occurring as brownish-yellow prisms or polycrystalline masses.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Charles Shepard (1804–1886). From German Fluocerit (in neutraler Fluocerit: C. F. A. Hartmann Lehrbuch der Mineral. u. Geol I. 227; see below, and compare † Flußcerit, † Ceriumfluat (both 1831 or earlier)) from fluo- + cer- (in Cerium) + -it, after French flucérine. Compare French fluocérite.
